p: The transmission of DENV by mosquitoes could be limited in wild ecosystems, where urban species of Aedes aegypti or A. albopictus; for example, in canopy forests (Mexico), other mosquito species inhabit the blood of bats, birds, and other wild animals ( Abundes-Gallegos et al., 2018). Recently, DENV was also found in Desmodus, as well as in ectoparasites of the order Diptera Streblidae, Strebla wiedemanni, and Trichobius parasiticus; it is an interesting finding since flies could also be involved in the maintenance of DENV in nature ( Abundes-Gallegos et al., 2018).
